page.title: 02Local History of Splott.
page.content: Splott was once a marshland.In the 13th century English settlers built seawalls and reclaimed from saltmarshes.They enclosed drained fields and called them plots which led to Splott.The most likely reason for the the word Splott is from the Welsh word 'YSBLAD' which means firm land surrounded by marsh..This became altered to Splott by the English settlers who couldn't speak Welsh. Less than 200 years ago Splott was farmland but towards the end of the 19th century the need for steel brought industry to Splott.Within a few years Splott changed from being a quiet farming community to a smokey industrial are.Today it is a run down inner city area which is trying,with the help of the Welsh Development Agency and others,to recover from the demise of the steelworks in 1978.
